    # Research

    # Master's and Bachelor's thesis topics:

    Motor Learning
    Create ubiquitous or VR tools to support dance learning and remote dance
    Human Augmentation
    Desing and create systems to help humans overcome their natural limitations
    Haptics
    Use the tactile sense to comunicate information or replicate real-world experiences in VR

    If you are interested Come to my office 😃 send me an email or contact me via the MIMUC slack workspace 😷

    # Current reseach

    Ongoing Human-Closed-Loop

    • Human-C-I as a control system to enhance human health and goals

    Ongoing Motor Learning

    • Wearable technologies to support digital dance and dance learning

    Ongoing Human Augmentation

    • Psycho-social aspects of human augmentation
    • Emotion Sharing

    Past Situational Awareness in Highly Automated Vehicles

    • Multisensory Integration
    • Haptic Support for SA

    # Ms.C research

    # 2020

    Short Paper Altering the Stiffness, Friction, and Shape Perception of Tangible Objects in Virtual Reality Using Wearable Haptics

    VILLA, S.; PACCHIEROTTI, C; DE TINGUY, X.; MACIEL, A.; MARCHAL, M.

    IEEE Transactions on Haptics 2020.

    VILLA, S.

    LUME Digital Repository.

    TICONA, J.; VILLA, S.; TORCHELSEN, R; MACIEL, A.; NEDEL, L.

    Computer Graphics International 2019.

    Short Paper Towards Moving Virtual Arms Using Brain-Computer Interface

    SALAS, J.;VILLA, S.; MACIEL, A.; NEDEL, L.; BARONE, D.

    Computer Graphics International 2019.
